FuzzyRuleset¶

class FuzzyRuleset(source: Union[str, List[Union[str, hotfis.rules.fuzzyrule.FuzzyRule]]])¶

Bases: object

Ruleset to be used in fuzzy inference system evaluation.

FuzzyRulesets are collections of rules that may be evaluated in membership inference. FuzzyRulesets can be defined directly with a List of str/FuzzyRules or by passing the path to text file with rules on separate lines.

Parameters

source – Filepath to file with rules or list of rules as rules or FuzzyRules.

rules¶

FuzzyRules comprising the ruleset.

Type

List[FuzzyRule]

input_names¶

Names of required inputs (ex. {“food”, “service”})

Type

Set[str]

output_names¶

Names of ruleset outputs (ex. {“tip”})

Type

Set[str]

Example

Method 1:

>>> ruleset1 = FuzzyRuleset([
>>>     "if temperature is cold then heater is on",
>>>     "if temperature is warm then heater is medium",
>>>     "if temperature is hot then heater is off",
>>> ])

Method 2:

=== example_rules.txt ===

if service is poor or food is rancid then tip is cheap
if service is good then tip is average
if service is excellent and food is delicioius then tip is generous

>>> ruleset2 = FuzzyRuleset("example_rules.txt")

Methods

__iter__()

Supports iteration through rules.

get_input_names()

Returns a set of required input names.

get_outputs_name()

Returns a set of output names.
